niagara.physical
Class PhysicalOperator

java.lang.Object
  niagara.optimizer.colombia.Op
      niagara.optimizer.colombia.PhysicalOp
          niagara.physical.PhysicalOperator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Initializable, Instrumentable, Schedulable, SchemaProducer, SerializableToXML
Direct Known Subclasses:
PhysicalAccumulate, PhysicalBucket, PhysicalConstruct, PhysicalDisplay, PhysicalDuplicate, PhysicalExpression, PhysicalGroup, PhysicalImpute, PhysicalIncrementalGroup, PhysicalJoin, PhysicalMagic, PhysicalMagicConstruct, PhysicalPartitionGroup, PhysicalPredicatedUnnest, PhysicalPrefix, PhysicalPresent, PhysicalPunctQC, PhysicalPunctuate, PhysicalSelect, PhysicalSelectF, PhysicalSort, PhysicalStore, PhysicalUnion, PhysicalUnnest, PhysicalWindowGroup, UnoptimizablePhysicalOperator
public abstract class PhysicalOperator
extends PhysicalOp
implements SchemaProducer, SerializableToXML, Initializable, Schedulable, Instrumentable

Method Detail

plugInStreams

public void plugInStreams(SourceTupleStream[] sourceStreams,
                          SinkTupleStream[] sinkStreams,
                          DataManager dm,
                          java.lang.Integer responsiveness)
Initialize the PhysicalOperator with the appropriate source streams, sink streams, whether the operator is blocking or non-blocking, the data manager it is working with, and the responsiveness of the operator to control information.

Parameters:
sourceStreams - The Source Streams associated with the operator
sinkStreams - The Sink Streams associated with the operator
blockingSourcetreams - A boolean array that specifies the source streams due to which the operator blocks.
responsiveness - The responsiveness, in milliseconds, to control messages

setBlockingSourceStreams

protected void setBlockingSourceStreams(boolean[] blockingSourceStreams)

protected void dataManagerInit(DataManager dm)

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Is this operator ready for execution (All sink streams in place?)

run

public final void run()
This function sets up the flow of control for the operator by reading from input streams and writing to sink streams. All control messages are handled here.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

shutDownOperator

private void shutDownOperator(java.lang.String msg)
This function sends (best effort) shutdown messages to all source and sink streams

endOperator

private void endOperator()
This function sends (best effort) shutdown messages to all source streams and eos/close messages to sink streams this will shutdown all source operators, but allow sink operators to complete processing as if stream from this operator ended

getFromSourceStreams

private void getFromSourceStreams(PhysicalOperator.SourceStreamsObject sourceObject,
                                  boolean timedOutLastTime)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                  ShutdownException
This function reads from a set of source streams specified by the variable activeSourceStreams and modifies sourceObject that contains the source element read and the stream from which it was read. If no source element was read, the the element field in sourceObject is set to null. This operation splits the responsiveness time of the operator among all the source streams it can read from. If this responsiveness time is exceeded, it returns null in the element field of sourceObject.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown if the thread is interrupted during execution write to a previously closed stream
ShutdownException - query shutdown by user or execution error

processGetPartialFromSink

void processGetPartialFromSink(int streamId)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                ShutdownException
This function processes a GetPartialResult control element received from a sink stream. If the control element is not a duplicate previously received from some other sink stream, then it is sent to all open source streams.

Parameters:
streamId - The id of the sink stream from which the getpartial element was read
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted during execution
ShutdownException - query shutdown by user or execution error

putTuple

public final void putTuple(Tuple tuple,
                           int streamId)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                           ShutdownException
Puts a tuple into a specified sink stream. To be called by the operator implementations themselves. (sort of replaced putToDestinationStreams)

Parameters:
tuple - The tuple to be put in the stream
streamId - the id of the stream where the tuple is to go
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread is interrupted during execution
ShutdownException - query shutdown by user or execution error

setMaxDelay

Set the maximum amount of time a tuple can be delayed in the stream. In milliseconds.

flushCurrentResults

protected void flushCurrentResults(boolean partial)
                            throws ShutdownException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
Requests that a (blocking) operator flush the current version of its results to the sink. This flush request may be do to a GET_PARTIAL request or due to end of stream.

Parameters:
partial - true if this is partial result output, false if this is the final result output
Throws:
ShutdownException - query shutdown by user or execution error
java.lang.InterruptedException

removeEffectsOfPartialResult

protected void removeEffectsOfPartialResult(int streamId)
This function removes the effects of the partial results in a given source stream.

Parameters:
streamId - The id of the source streams the partial result of which are to be removed.

processPunctuation

protected void processPunctuation(Punctuation tuple,
                                  int streamId)
                           throws ShutdownException,
                                  java.lang.InterruptedException
This function handles punctuations for the given operator. The default behavior is to ignore the punctuation and continue

Parameters:
tuple - The current input tuple to examine.
streamId - The id of the source streams the partial result of which are to be removed.
Throws:
ShutdownException
java.lang.InterruptedException
